title: BBC Local Live: Devon and Cornwall on Tuesday 17 October 2017 - BBC News
summary: poldark makers 'targeted by north korean hackers ' .
south west house price fall revealed in study .
homeless train travel : exeter council spends £ 4,651 .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on wednesday 18 october 2017 .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 on wednesday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: liverpool gangsters 'thought devon was easy target '
text: an eight-strong liverpool gang who failed in a series of atm raids in south devon thought the area would be an `` easy target '' said police .
all eight were jailed for more than 48 years at exeter crown court , which heard how each raid was unsuccessful when explosives failed to ignite and a tow bar did n't work .
judge erik salomonsen told them : `` this type of crime is an increasing danger to society .
`` more and more desperate individuals are resorting to the use of explosives to raid machines and deterrence must play a part in sentences . ''
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: in fudge , dartmoor zoo 's syrian bear
text: she 's been a permanent fixture at the zoo since 1983 , but it was with great sadness that owner ben mee announced the death of fudge , dartmoor zoo 's 39-year-old syrian brown bear .
the zoo said her long term companion , hayley the european brown bear , will be `` monitored closely '' over the coming months for signs of distress .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: weather update : rain continues
text: the cloud will thicken bringing some outbreaks of rain .
it will also feel much fresher .
winds will remain light overnight with low cloud , mist and fog spreading north across all parts .
the rain will turn patchier as it edges northwards through the night .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: explosive gas failed , tow bar and strap broke in series of bungled devon atm raids by liverpool gang
text: a liverpool gang tried to blow up devon cash point machines by pumping them full of oxy-acetylene gas used in welding but it failed to ignite , a court heard .
exeter crown court court heard that oxy-acetylene raids at natwest in newton road , torquay , and barclays at st marychurch on 7 and 8 december 2015 failed .
the gang also tried to use a 4x4 to drag out atms at co-ops on dartmouth but the tow bar broke and paignton when a strap broke .
a security guard robbery in brixham , devon , led to the gang 's capture thanks to cctv footage , the court heard .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: exeter council 'committed ' to tackling homelessness
text: exeter city council has defended its policy of funding train travel for homeless people .
the council spent £ 4,651 reconnecting 107 rough sleepers in two-and-a-half years , the victoria derbyshire show has found .
it was one of 10 across england who told the bbc they are regularly buying one-way train tickets for homeless people out of their area .
some spent more than £ 1,000 a year on fares and charity homeless link called the scale `` worrying '' .
councillor emma morse said the took every step to help the homeless `` including funding tickets for them to get back to loved ones if they do n't have the means . ''
`` we are 100 % committed to tackling homelessness in the city and making sure everyone has a roof over their head .
`` we have always prided ourselves not only at being an open and honest authority but also a compassionate and caring council , '' she said .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: falmouth nursery rated 'inadequate '
text: a nursery in falmouth has been given an inadequate rating after ofsted inspectors found failings in its management and the behaviour and welfare of the children .
the first friends nursery on dracaena avenue had 34 children on its register aged up to eight when it was inspected in the middle of last month .
ofsted says it will take steps to cancel registration .
there was no reply when the bbc approached the school a short time ago .
a previous inspection in 2016 rated the nursery as good .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: travel : delays on the m5 northbound
text: travel : delays on the m5 northbound
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: bungling devon cashpoint raiders from liverpool jailed
text: a liverpool gang who tried to blow up devon cash machines in a series of failed raids have been jailed .
the gang tried to blow the machines out of the wall by pumping them full of oxy-acetylene gas used in welding but it failed to ignite , a court heard .
they also tried to drag cashpoints from walls and failed .
they were all jailed for a total of more than 48 years at exeter crown court .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: mike samwell death : stolen car 'driven backwards and forwards ' over victim
text: an ex-royal navy officer was run over and crushed to death trying to stop thieves stealing his car as his wife looked on , a court has heard .
mike samwell , 35 , had been woken in the early hours by a break-in at his home in chorlton , manchester , in april .
he had run out of the house , and when his wife followed she found him on his back with tyre marks on his chest .
manchester crown court heard he had been run over twice by ryan gibbons , 29 , who denies murder .

documents.title: cornwall party calls on pm to scrap boundary review
text: the leader of mebyon kernow , which campaigns for a national assembly for cornwall , has called on the theresa may to scrap an electoral boundary review .
councillor dick cole is concerned it would lead to the creation of an `` unpopular '' cross-tamar constituency .
under the plans , the voting district would cover bideford , bude , and launceston .

councillor cole said : we will certainly be continuing with our campaigns to protect the territorial integrity of cornwall , and for cornwall to be treated as a distinct entity for the purposes of governance . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: otter conservationist 'like a kid ' when he sees the animal
text: he might have been working to protect otters for 40 years , but dave webb , from north devon , says he still gets excited when he sees the animal .
author: Hayley Westcott
Broadcast Journalist

documents.title: calls to cancel katie hopkins ' appearance at lewes speakers festival
text: calls have been made to cancel an appearance by controversial columnist katie hopkins at a literary festival .
lewes speakers festival manager marc rattray said he would not cancel ms hopkins ' talk in sussex unless he was `` forced '' to .
`` people have gone to the council , tried to have her banned under the rules of the venue , and i 've had a lot of emails suggesting i withdraw her , '' he said .
ms hopkins , from exeter , said : `` it 's ok not to agree , but please do n't attack the organiser . ''
author: BBC News England

documents.title: mum 'loses everything ' in fire sparked by tumble dryer
text: a single mum has been left homeless after her tumble dryer caught fire .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: 'too many voters ' for cornwall-only districts
text: plans to redefine cornwall 's parliamentary constituencies enter their final consultation with a cornwall-devon seat still a central aim .
the boundary commission 's review manager gerald tassier says rules state each seat can only be 5 % above or below the average size constituency .
`` cornwall , with the isles of scilly , has too many electors to form five constituencies on its own . ''
`` one of the arguments that people from cornwall have been raising is that it should be treated as a separate review area to the rest of the south west .
`` but unfortunately to do so , would be to create constituencies that are outside that 5 % band , '' he said .
the boundary commission wants to reduce the number of mps by 50 so each of the 600 remaining represent the same number of voters across the country .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: council pulls the plug on new torquay railway station funding
text: torbay councillors will be asked to stop spending money on a planned new £ 13m railway station on the outskirts of torquay .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: dartmoor zoo 's syrian bear dies
text: dartmoor zoo has announced `` with great sadness '' that its syrian brown bear fudge has died , aged 39 .
`` over the past several months she has been monitored closely by our keepers and vets and has shown ongoing deterioration in health , including chronic arthritis , '' zoo owner ben mee said .
born at london zoo in 1978 , the syrian brown bear arrived at dartmoor zoo in 1983 to live in captivity with a group of european brown bears .
mr mee said fudge was `` greatly loved by our staff , volunteers and visitors '' and would be sorely missed .
mr mee bought dartmoor zoo in 2006 and wrote a book about his family 's battle to run it .
in 2012 , matt damon and scarlett johansson starred in the film we bought a zoo , based on the book .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: truro city chairman eyeing cup upset
text: the chairman of truro city - the first cornish side to get to the fa cup first round since 1969 - says his side can cause an upset against league one 's charlton athletic .
pete masters says his national league south side are capable of showing their skills on the national stage .
he hopes the game against charlton will put cornish football on the map .
`` let 's hope we can get it on the television as well because that will be a boost to the finances , but also it will be a boost for cornwall as a whole .
`` it 's a great opportunity for everyone to see it in cornwall , it 's great for cornish football , it 's going to raise the profile , '' he said .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: salmon return to dartmoor river to spawn
text: new spawning habitats are bringing salmon back to a stretch of dartmoor river .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: 'normal ' skies captured by our weather watchers
text: the skies are looking much less hazy and orange than yesterday .
thanks to our weather watchers scuba , lucy , and clare for sending these lovely in from across cornwall and devon this morning .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: fish and chip shop fire out
text: cornwall fire and rescue service has put out a blaze at a st ives fish and chip shop .
at 10:54 the control room received multiple calls from worried people .
the brigade has praised staff for evacuating the restaurant , saying good fire safety had saved lives .
at harbour lights fish & chip shop st ives .
well done to staff for deploying wet chemical & full evacuation .
good # firesafety saves lives
i know !
how scary : (
good stop
thought it was just called 'harbour ' not harbour lights ?
either way cracking chippy !
great work !
please can we use your photos ?
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: 'silly money ' but devon village sees biggest house price drop
text: house values have fallen in the devon village of halberton by more than 40 % in a decade , the largest drop in the south west , according to analysis for bbc news .
but that brings little comfort for neil potter , who rents a three-bedroom house in halberton .
he says it is too expensive to buy in the village .
`` we rent our house - we ca n't get on the market because we 've got three kids and to buy a four-bed , you 're looking at £ 330,000 house prices in devon and this area are quite expensive . ''
`` we 've been here 12 months - we rented in tiverton before .
`` that was a four-bed and to buy that , it was about £ 260,000 .
the three-bed we 're renting in halberton is worth around £ 330,000 - silly money , '' mr potter said .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: electrical fire still burning
text: a fire at the electricity substation in marazion continues to burn 25 hours after crews were first called .
officers from helston and tolvaddon spent the night there .
penzance crews are now keeping it under control until it 's put out with foam .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: serious concerns raised over torquay care home
text: a care home in torquay has been rated inadequate and told it must improve .
inspectors say ashbourne house in st marychurch is failing to protect its residents from harm , with insufficient staffing levels .
on a visit earlier this year , the care quality commission found residents were not being treated with respect and dignity , and on some occasions were being ignored when they were distressed .
the home has been put into `` special measures '' which means it must improve within six months or face possible closure .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: boundary commission changes : what 's happening ?
text: revised proposals for the shape of parliamentary seats at the next general election , published today , are recommending changes for the south west of england .
the region has been allocated 53 constituencies , a reduction of two from the current number .
10 of the 55 existing areas in the south west region remain unchanged .
among four cross-county constituencies being proposed is the bideford , bude and launceston voting district , which crosses the county boundary between cornwall and devon ,
former north cornwall mp lord paul tyler said the size of the proposed seat would make representing all constituents `` extremely difficult '' .
the proposed constituency boundaries in england , scotland and wales have been drawn up on the basis the total number of mps will be cut from 650 to 600 .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: developer promises £ 170 million investment and 600 jobs
text: the developer behind a new student village on the edge of the falmouth university campus said the £ 170 million investment will strengthen the university 's growth for the next 15 years .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: devon villagers surprised by house price fall
text: residents of a devon village have expressed their surprise after learning property values had dropped in the area in real terms .
prices have fallen in halberton by more than 40 % in a decade , the largest drop in the south west .
in more than half of england and wales house prices are lower in real terms than they were in 2007 , according to analysis for bbc news .
heather adwick has lived in halberton for 39 years and said she did not think the village was a cheap place to buy .
`` i did n't think the prices had gone down because we 're amazed by one house - a cottage - on the main road which is up for £ 410,000 .
`` i ca n't believe it - we 're always amazed by how much people are putting them up for , '' she said .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: cornish seal sanctuary expanding
text: the cornish seal sanctuary is expanding its hospital to take in more seal pups , the first major investment for almost 20 years .
the riverside site at gweek , near helston , was last refurbished in 1998 .
since then 864 seal pups have been rescued and spent time in the pens and pools which overlook the helford river .
a further £ 50,000 has been spent on three new isolation pens , a deep wet pen , seal pup kitchen , walk-in fridge and a new fibreglass roof .
other pens have been modernised and a new fresh air system .
the hospital is being re-launched officially today , right in the middle of the pupping season and as newborns are at particular risk from stormy seas .
author: Hannah Stacey
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: devon man recognised for otter conservation
text: a man from north devon is to receive national recognition for his work protecting otters .
dave webb developed a passion for the animals as a teenager and has spent the last 40 years campaigning to save them .
he will be honoured later today with a special award by the international fund for animal welfare at the house of lords .
mr webb is the founder of registered charity the uk wild otter trust , which works with the angling community and fishing industry with the aim of stopping cruelty towards the animals .
as part of his work he films the otters using special movement sensitive cameras and says individual animals can be easily identified .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: 'devonwall ' mp would find it 'extremely difficult '
text: any mp covering a proposed `` devonwall '' constituency would find it difficult to represent constituents in both counties , according to a former north cornwall mp .
the controversial cross-border parliamentary seat could still be created , according to proposals put forward by the boundary commission for england today .
the voting district would cover bideford , bude and launceston .
lord paul tyler said the size of the proposed seat will cause issues .
`` in practical terms it would be extremely difficult to straddle such a huge area and be responsible to people on the other side of the tamar , '' the former liberal democrat mp added .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: police appeal after 'high value ' burglary
text: watches , jewellery and laptops were taken from a home in a `` high value '' burglary in newquay , police have said .
the property on pentire road was broken into through patio doors between 13 and 16 october , officers said .
det con steve applewhite said there would be an increased police presence in the pentire area in a bid to `` reassure the public and prevent this type of crime happening again '' .
if you discover any discarded property which seems out of place whilst out and about please notify the police as it may help us identify who is responsible , '' he said .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: homeless train travel : exeter council spends £ 4,651
text: exeter city council spent £ 4,651 reconnecting 107 rough sleepers in two-and-a-half years , the victoria derbyshire show has found .
the council is one among 10 across england who told the bbc they bought train tickets to reconnect rough sleepers with family .
however , it 's understood a number of councils in england are regularly buying one-way train tickets for homeless people out of their area .
the charity homeless link described the victoria derbyshire programme 's findings as `` worrying '' .
its chief executive rick henderson said that if `` a person has a support network in a different area , then helping them reconnect can help to end their rough sleeping '' .

but he added : `` simply displacing rough sleepers without offering support is not solving the issue , and at worst can exacerbate their situation , leaving them more isolated and at risk of deteriorating physical and mental health . ''
exeter city council said : `` as a minimum , a housing options appointment is set up with the local authority in the area '' .
author: Victoria Derbyshire

documents.title: tide times across the region
text: if you 're heading to the coast today , here are the next high water times .
author: Alex Osborne
BBC Weather

documents.title: signal fault causes disruption between penzance and st erth
text: a fault with the signalling system between penzance and st erth is causing disruption to journeys , national rail enquiries has said .
`` trains may be delayed by up to 30 minutes or cancelled .
disruption is expected to continue until 11:00 .
`` great western railway customers may use first kernow buses on route , '' it added .
disruption between penzance and st erth until approximately 11:00 # penzance

documents.title: cancer widow calls for assisted dying law change
text: a former cornwall councillor is calling for people to join her campaign to raise awareness of the issues around assisted dying .
stephanie mcwilliam 's experience of losing her husband to throat cancer has led her to believe there should be a change in the law , which currently prohibits assisted suicide or euthanasia .
`` we are not asking for anybody to make a decision for somebody else .
`` nobody should be able to chose when somebody else dies , but equally i want to be able to choose for myself if i find myself in that situation , '' she said .
opponents say the law is vital to protect the weak and vulnerable .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: weather : a quieter today as ex-hurricane ophelia moves away
text: the winds are significantly lighter than yesterday , but we will see some rain arriving later on into this afternoon .
a dry and brighter start initially , with lighter winds , but turning downhill as we see some rain arriving from the south , courtesy of a weather front moving through .
a fresher feel , with highs of 16c ( 60f ) .
author: Alex Osborne
BBC Weather

documents.title: poldark makers 'targeted by north korean hackers '
text: the british television company which produces bbc tv hit poldark has been targeted by north korean hackers after it became involved in making a drama about the country , it has emerged .
the series - due to be written by an oscar-nominated screenwriter - has been shelved .
in august 2014 , channel 4 announced what it said would be a new `` bold and provocative '' drama series .
titled opposite number , the programme 's plot involved a british nuclear scientist taken prisoner in north korea .
the production firm involved - mammoth screen , which also produces itv 's victoria - subsequently had its computers attacked .
the project has not moved forward because of a failure to secure funding , the company says .
author: Gordon Corera
Security correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: dying dad battles pain with daughter by his side in charity run
text: through sheer willpower and determination , terminal brain cancer sufferer jay taylor puts on a brave face and completes the great west fun run .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: totnes development plans rejected
text: a controversial report that suggested building on a devon town 's much loved riverside area has been thrown out by councillors .
it was commissioned as part of the neighbourhood plan in totnes , and suggested building new homes on steamer quay , a popular leisure area .
totnes town councillors rejected the report at a meeting on monday evening , saying steamer quay needed to be protected .
councillor judy westacott said she was `` shocked '' by the plans .
`` i totally agree with the council 's decision to ignore completely that document , '' she said .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: south west house price fall revealed in study
text: exclusive house price figures from the bbc reveal sale prices are now lower in real terms than they were 10 years ago in two-thirds of the south west .

using figures from the land registry , the bbc and open data institute found that while the actual sale price has risen in nine out of 10 areas , if inflation is taken into account then `` real terms '' prices have actually decreased in about seven out of 10 council wards since 2007 .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: 'devonwall ' constituency still possible
text: the boundary commission is still proposing to create a controversial cross-border parliamentary seat on the devon-cornwall border .
despite some opposition to a so-called `` devonwall '' constituency called bideford , bude and launceston , the commission 's third version of the plans maintain the cross-border seat .
in 2010 , a previous plan was defeated in parliament .

the current proposals are part of an idea to cut the number of mps from 650 to 600 but some sceptics believe the proposals wo n't secure enough support from mps , particularly the democratic unionist party .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for tuesday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online
